etymology.description: 买 is the simplified form of 買 (mǎi, "buy"). 買 (mǎi, "buy") is an ideogrammic compound composed of 网 (wǎng, "net") + 貝 (bèi, "money cowry"). Another interpretation considers it a phono-semantic compound: phonetic abbreviation 羅 (luó, "to net") + semantic 貝 (bèi, "money cowry").
etymology.interpretation: The character 買 (mǎi, "buy") originally combined elements of a net, indicating the act of acquiring, with cowry shells, which were used as currency to signify purchase. The simplified form 买 retains the basic structure but is streamlined for easier writing.
etymology.simplification: 买 is a simplified version where the complex 网 (wǎng, "net") component in 買 (mǎi, "buy") was removed, retaining the central 貝 (bèi, "money cowry") aspect to maintain its association with buying.

examples.chinese: 我打算买苹果(我打算買蘋果)，因为它们很新鲜(因為它們很新鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dǎsuàn mǎi píngguǒ, yīnwèi tāmen hěn xīnxiān.
examples.english: I plan to buy apples because they are very fresh.

examples.chinese: 他准备买一件新衣服(他準備買一件新衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǔnbèi mǎi yī jiàn xīn yīfú.
examples.english: He is preparing to buy a new piece of clothing.
